workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 6.1 - Foundation

textevent.message: Welcome to the final week of the 6wk Beginner FTP Builder! Let's get the legs spinning up here.
Make sure you have your fluids, fan, and towel all set!
3mins into it so far. Hopefully the legs are starting to feel a little looser and the pedal stroke is becoming fluid.
That's halfway through! Let's chat a little bit about what's planned for today.
Today, we have 5 intervals to tackle, with each starting at zone 3, and finishing at zone 2.
The breakdown is 3mins at 88% FTP, plus 5mins at 73% FTP, with 2mins rest, 5 times.
We'll also be playing around with the cadence, bike position, etc. to break up the intervals a bit further.
But, all with the continued goal of progressively overloading your body and pushing your FTP higher.
Sound good? Thought so! :-) Let's keep on warming up here.
1min to go, then we're going right into our first interval.
Remember, we're starting at zone 3 first today, then finishing at zone 2.
Here we go! Let's start off at 90-100 cadence for this first set.
All right, bring the power up to zone 3, and let's settle into 90-100 RPM.
We're here for 3mins.
Working in zone 3 during these Foundation workouts places a bit more stress on the body.
And will hopefully create even more adaptation once you allow your body to rest and recover.
In 30sec, we're going to drop to zone 2, but keep the cadence the same.
All right, reduce the power just slightly here, but keep those legs spinning.
We're here for 5mins now.
You should hopefully see a slight reduction in heart rate at this effort relative to zone 3.
This is simply due to this intensity requiring less energy to meet its demands.
That's halfway! You're looking great here! Keep that cadence up.
1min to go! Take it on home here :-)
Awesome work! That's 1 down, and 4 to go. We'll take a quick 2mins rest between sets.
Use these rests well, take a few deep breaths, and make sure you're continuing to drink.
In 30sec, we're back up again! This time, we're starting at 100 RPM.
Here we go, FAST FEET! Get those legs spinning up nice and high.
At this cadence, you should see a slightly higher heart rate, this is due to increased metabolic demands.
Higher cadence also helps work more slow twitch fibers due to the decreased force required.
All right, in 30sec we're going to drop our cadence to 90 RPM for our 5min zone 2 interval.
Bring the cadence and effort down again here. Steady as you go now.
Take a few deep breaths if that high cadence work really taxed you, that will help you recover.
Halfway through again, my friend! Great effort today!
Keep that cadence nice and steady for this final minute, and let the tension go in your shoulders.
Nice! Just 3 more to go :-) These are a little more work than just plain zone 2, huh?
Exactly what we need to get stronger!
Interval #3 is coming up in 30sec. This time we're going to ramp down to zone 2.
All right, let's start a little higher this time, and again between 90-100 RPM.
We'll ramp things down over the 3min interval, get the work done!
Keep the cadence up here! The power will continue to ramp down slowly...
30sec to go here, then we'll steady the power out at zone 2 at 90 RPM again, keep it up!
All right, bring the power down a bit more, and let's keep it steady for the next 5mins.
Aim for right around 90 RPM here, and keep that pedal stroke smooth and consistent.
Take a few deep breaths again if you need to, learn to recover under pressure.
Relax your shoulders, bend the elbows slightly, loosen the grip on your bars.
Final minute! Keep it going all the way to the line!
Beautiful! That's 3 down, and just 2 to go :-) Take a couple of minutes easy again here.
All right, next up, we're going do the entire interval between 90-100 RPM again. Get ready!
Here we go!, bring the power up to zone 3, and let's settle into 90-100 RPM.
Working in zone 3 during these Foundation workouts places a bit more stress on the body.
And will hopefully create even more adaptation once you allow your body to rest and recover.
In 30sec, we're going to drop to zone 2, but keep the cadence the same.
All right, reduce the power just slightly here, but keep those legs spinning.
We're here for 5mins now.
You should hopefully see a slight reduction in heart rate at this effort relative to zone 3.
This is simply due to this intensity requiring less energy to meet its demands.
That's halfway! You're looking great here! Keep that cadence up.
1min to go! Take it on home here :-)
Great effort! Let's take a couple of minutes nice and easy again here.
All right, for our last interval, let's start off at a nice high cadence of 100 RPM!
Here we go, FAST FEET! Get those legs spinning up nice and high.
At this cadence, you should see a slightly higher heart rate, this is due to increased metabolic demands.
Higher cadence also helps work more slow twitch fibers due to the decreased force required.
All right, in 30sec we're going to drop our cadence to 90 RPM for our 5min zone 2 interval.
Bring the cadence and effort down again here. Steady as you go now.
Take a few deep breaths if that high cadence work really taxed you, that will help you recover.
Halfway through again, my friend! Great effort today!
Keep that cadence nice and steady for this final minute, and let the tension go in your shoulders.
Nice work progressing the Foundation workout once again today and adding in some zone 3.
We're going to spend a few minute cooling down now, and then hop off the bike.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
